column1: Calenhad was the penultimate Warning beacons of Gondor of Gondor
column2: being the sixth from east to west and located to south-east of Firienholt.

column1: Calenhad is described as being a small
column3: treeless hill which was slightly bigger and taller than Erelas.
column4: pp. 19-20 Calenhad was seldom lit and its lighting during the War of the Ring indicated great urgency.

column1: On the night of 7 March  Gandalf and Peregrin Took
column3: saw the beacons being lit to call for aid from Rohan.

column1: It is suggested in the Unfinished Tales that Calenhad probably means "green space" from calen "green" and sad (lenition to had) "place
